lexUnit.name: oppose.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: disapprove of, resist, or be hostile to.

sentence.text: The purchase order is vigorously opposed by the Wolverhampton branch of CAMRA .
The idea was strongly opposed by Britain , and quickly vetoed by the Council of Ministers .
That has been opposed by Mr Oscar Arias , President of Costa Rica , who will chair the summit meeting .
The company is firmly opposed to discounting on the grounds that it undermines standards .
Britain has always been strongly opposed to nuclear proliferation .
We were strongly opposed to the licensing of two sensitive blocks of sea bed close to Bardsey Island .
The conference was vehemently opposed by Gulbuddin Hekmatyar , leader of the Hezb-e Islami , the principal fundamentalist faction .
People who oppose religion on the grounds of its intolerance and bigotry think that the risks are very high .
Ostentatiously non-sectarian , Larkin was invariably opposed by the Catholic hierarchy on social issues .
It also suggests that teachers should oppose their critics on educational grounds rather than being forced continually onto the sterile terrain of vocationalism .
We have also totally opposed some practices such as the use of live bait .
The Hungarians were once bitterly opposed to the Habsburgs .
In September 1915 the TUC unanimously opposed conscription , despite its overwhelming support for the war .
I opposed it from the very beginning .
Neither is being opposed by the Liberal Democrats .
Indians oppose Arctic drilling
The SDP opposes further nationalization , believing it to be inefficient .
Others who opposed the war in Vietnam are all for it .
she has opposed every new European law which would give women more justice .
He was ` very opposed " to petrol rationing and maintained that rota cuts , organised systematically , would be the only effective method -- and they were out of the question .
If you wish to oppose the granting of such decree you should put your reasons in writing and send your letter to the address shown below .
